MeasurementToolMetadata.Description: Kiddie Schedule for Affective Disorders and Schizophrenia- Present and Lifetime (K-SADS-PL) - ADHD portion and supplemental(if necessary)
MeasurementToolMetadata.Citation: Kaufman, J., Birmaher, B., Brent, D., Rao, U., Flynn, C., Moreci, P., . . . Ryan, N. (1997). Schedule for Affective Disorders and Schizophrenia for School-Age Children-Present and Lifetime Version (K-SADS-PL): Initial Reliability and Validity Data. Journal of the American Academy of Child & Adolescent Psychiatry, 36(7), 980-988. doi:10.1097/00004583-199707000-00021

K-SADS-PL_Summary.Description: Wholistic KSADS diagnostic summary as reviewed by licensed clinical psychologist.

Difficulty_Attention.Description: Difficulty Sustaining Attention on Tasks or Play Activities

levels.2: Subthreshold: Occasionallly has difficulty sustaining attention on tasks or play activites. Problem has minimal effect on functioning.
levels.3: Threshold: Often has difficulty sustaining attention. Problem has moderate to severe effect on functioning

levels.2: Subthreshold: Occasionallly forgetful. Problem has only minimal effect on functioning.
levels.3: Threshold: Attention often disrupted by minor distractions other kids would be able to ignore. Problem has moderate to severe effect on functioning.

levels.2: Subthreshold: Occasionallly has difficulty remaining seated when required to do so. Problem has only minimal effect on functioning.
levels.3: Threshold: Often has difficulty remaining seated when required to do so. Problem has moderate to severe effect on functioning.

levels.2: Subthreshold: Occasionallly has difficulty remaining seated when required to do so. Problem has only minimal effect on functioning.
levels.3: Threshold: Often has difficulty remaining seated when required to do so. Problem has moderate to severe effect on functioning.

Careless_Mistakes.Description: Makes a lot of Careless Mistakes

levels.2: Subthreshold: Occasionallly makes careless mistakes. Problem has only minimal effect on functioning.
levels.3: Threshold: Often makes careless mistakes. Problem has moderate to severe effect on functioning.

levels.2: Subthreshold: Occasionallly doesn't listen. Problem has only minimal effect on functioning.
levels.3: Threshold: Often does not listen. Problem has moderate to severe effect on functioning.

levels.2: Subthreshold: Occasionallly has difficulty following instructions. Problem has only minimal effect on functioning.
levels.3: Threshold: Often has difficulty following instructions. Problem has moderate to severe effect on functioning.

levels.2: Subthreshold: Occasionallly disorganized. Problem has only minimal effect on functioning.
levels.3: Threshold: Often disorganized. Problem has moderate to severe effect on functioning.

levels.2: Subthreshold: Occasionallly avoids tasks that require sustained attention, and/or expresses mild dislike for these tasks. Problem has only minimal effect on functioning.
levels.3: Threshold: Often avoids tasks that require sustained attention, and/or expresses moderate dislike for these tasks. Problem has moderate to severe effect on functioning.

levels.2: Subthreshold: Occasionallly loses things. Problem has only minimal effect on functioning.
levels.3: Threshold: Often loses things (e.g. once a week or more). Problem has moderate to severe effect on functioning.

levels.2: Subthreshold: Occasionallly forgetful. Problem has only minimal effect on functioning.
levels.3: Threshold: Often forgetful. Problem has moderate to severe effect on functioning.

levels.2: Subthreshold: Occasionallly fidgets with hands or feet or squirms in seat. Problem has only minimal effect on functioning.
levels.3: Threshold: Often fidgets with hands or feet or squirms in seat (e.g. At least 50% of the time). Problem has moderate to severe effect on functioning.

levels.2: Subthreshold: Occasionallly runs about or climbs excessively. Problem has only minimal effect on functioning. (In adolescents, may be limited to a subjective feeling of restlessness.)
levels.3: Threshold: Often runs about or climbs excessively. Problem has moderate to severe effect on functioning.(In adolescents, may be limited to a subjective feeling of restlessness.)

Driven_Motor.Description: On the Go/Acts Like Driven by Motor

levels.2: Subthreshold: Occasionallly, minimal effect on functioning.
levels.3: Threshold: Often acts as if driven by motor. Moderate to severe effect on functioning.

levels.2: Subthreshold: Occasionally has difficulty playing quietly. Problem has only minimal effect on functioning.
levels.3: Threshold: Often has difficulty playing quietly. Problem has moderate to severe effect on functioning

levels.2: Subthreshold: Occasionally talks out of turn. Problem has only minimal effect on functioning.
levels.3: Threshold: Often talks out of turn (e.g. daily or nearly daily). Problem has moderate to severe effect on functioning

levels.2: Subthreshold: Occasionally has difficulty waiting his/her turn. Problem has only minimal effect on functioning.
levels.3: Threshold: Often has difficulty waiting his/her turn. Problem has moderate to severe effect on functioning

levels.2: Subthreshold: Occasionally interrupts others.
levels.3: Threshold: Often interrupts others.

levels.2: Subthreshold: Occasionally shifts tasks and does not finish activities.
levels.3: Threshold: Often shifts tasks and does not finish activities.

levels.2: Subthreshold: Occasionally talks excessively.
levels.3: Threshold: Often talks excessively.

levels.2: Subthreshold: Occasionally engages in activities that are physically dangerous.
levels.3: Threshold: Often engages in activites that are physically dangerous.
